mission: Launch the 'Genesis' Digital Twin project by executing a flawless, secure, and on-brand sales event for 50 limited-edition luxury watches. The MVP focuses on a fair online drop, secure checkout, and the reliable delivery of both the physical watch and its corresponding NFT digital twin to the owner's wallet.

workstreams.foundation: Establish the core infrastructure, architecture, and security posture for the project.
workstreams.pre_purchase: Develop the user journey from product discovery to successful purchase, including the virtual queue and checkout.
workstreams.post_purchase: Develop the owner's experience after purchase, including delivery scheduling, wallet onboarding, and NFT fulfillment.

tickets.summary: Foundation: Define overall system architecture and data models
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the PRD's technical and data integrity requirements
When I design the system architecture
Then the design must include service boundaries for web, API, queue, and blockchain services.
And it must define the schemas for the User, Order, Asset Master, and Delivery records.
And it must specify the technology stack for front-end, back-end, and database.

tickets.summary: Foundation: Provision cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipeline
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the need for a scalable and reliable platform
When I provision the cloud environment using IaC
Then an auto-scaling, containerized or serverless hosting environment must be created.
And a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing and deployment must be in place.
And environments for development, staging, and production must be configured.

tickets.summary: Foundation: Configure WAF, DDoS protection, and security monitoring
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the high-value nature of the transaction
When I configure the network and application security
Then a Web Application Firewall (WAF) and DDoS mitigation service must be active.
And logging and alerting for security events must be configured.
And all data transport must be enforced over TLS 1.2+.

tickets.summary: Pre-Purchase: Architect the Product Discovery Page (US-101)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the need for a rich product page
When I design the page architecture
Then I must define the API contract for fetching product content from a CMS.
And I must specify the UX flow for the 360-degree view and video player.
And the design must accommodate high-resolution, zoomable images.

tickets.summary: Pre-Purchase: Implement the Genesis Product Page front-end (US-101)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Scenario: Viewing the Genesis Product Page
  Given I am a visitor on the website
  When I navigate to the "Genesis" product page
  Then I must see high-resolution, zoomable images of the watch.
  And I must see an interactive 360-degree view of the watch.
  And I must be able to play a high-quality promotional video.
  And I should see a dedicated section explaining the "Digital Twin" NFT in simple, benefit-driven terms.
  And the page content must be loaded from a Content Management System (CMS).

tickets.summary: Pre-Purchase: Architect the Virtual Queue and Fair Drop System (US-102)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the requirement for a fair drop
When I design the queueing system
Then the design must include a bot-resistant entry mechanism.
And it must define the logic for user selection and redirection to checkout.
And it must specify the API for managing queue state and real-time stock counters.

tickets.summary: Pre-Purchase: Implement the Virtual Queue and Purchase Limit Logic (US-102)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Scenario: User enters the queue and is selected to purchase
  Given the drop is active and has not sold out
  And I am logged into my verified user account
  When I click the "Enter Queue" button on the product page
  Then I should be placed into a virtual queue.
  And when I am selected from the queue, I am redirected to the checkout page.
  And a 10-minute checkout timer starts.

tickets.summary: Pre-Purchase: Architect the Secure Checkout Flow (US-103)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the need for a secure, high-value transaction
When I design the checkout flow
Then the design must be PCI DSS compliant.
And it must detail the payment pre-authorization and admin-triggered capture logic.
And it must define the API endpoints and data flow for creating an Order Record.

tickets.summary: Pre-Purchase: Implement the Secure Checkout and Payment Pre-Authorization (US-103)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Scenario: Successful High-Value Checkout
  Given I have been selected from the queue and am in the checkout flow
  And I have entered my valid shipping and payment details
  When I click "Confirm Purchase"
  Then my payment method should be pre-authorized for the full amount.
  And I should be redirected to an "Order Confirmation" page with my order summary.
  And I should receive an order confirmation email.

tickets.summary: Pre-Purchase: QA Verification for Product Page, Queue, and Checkout
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the Pre-Purchase features are implemented
When I perform end-to-end testing
Then all acceptance criteria for US-101, US-102, and US-103 must be met.
And the purchase limit of one per customer must be enforced.
And the checkout timer must correctly expire the session.

tickets.summary: Post-Purchase: Architect the Owner's Portal and Delivery Scheduling (US-201, US-204)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the need for a premium post-purchase experience
When I design the 'My Collection' portal
Then the design must include a secure messaging system between owner and concierge.
And it must define the API and UX for the white-glove delivery scheduling interface.
And it must specify how delivery status is tracked and displayed.

Scenario: Scheduling concierge delivery
  Given I have successfully purchased the watch and am on the order confirmation page
  When I click the "Schedule Your Delivery" button
  Then I am taken to a scheduling interface.
  And I can select from available dates and time slots for my delivery.
  And upon confirming a slot, I receive a calendar invitation via email.

tickets.summary: Post-Purchase: Architect Wallet Submission and NFT Transfer Automation (US-202, US-203)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the need to deliver the digital twin
When I design the NFT fulfillment process
Then the design must include a secure method for users to submit a wallet address.
And it must define an automated, trigger-based system for transferring the NFT upon delivery confirmation.
And it must include robust error handling and a retry mechanism for blockchain transactions.

Scenario: User adds and verifies a wallet address
  Given I am logged into my account and navigating the "My Collection" portal
  When I go to the "Add Wallet" section
  Then I see a field to paste my public wallet address (e.g., 0x...).
  And the system validates that the address is a syntactically correct format.
  And after submitting, the status of my NFT delivery is "Pending Wallet Verification".

Scenario: NFT is transferred upon delivery confirmation
  Given the concierge has marked the delivery as "Complete" in the admin system
  When the automated transfer job runs
  Then the NFT corresponding to my watch's unique serial number is transferred to my verified wallet address.
  And the NFT's metadata correctly includes the model, serial number, and date of manufacture.
  And the status of my NFT in the "My Collection" portal changes to "Delivered".

Scenario: Viewing the owner portal
  Given I am a new owner and I log into my account
  When I navigate to "My Collection"
  Then I see a visual representation of my "Genesis" watch.
  And I see the current status of my delivery (e.g., "Scheduled", "In Transit", "Delivered").
  And I can access a secure messaging thread to communicate with my assigned concierge.

tickets.summary: Post-Purchase: QA Verification for Owner Portal and NFT Delivery
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the Post-Purchase features are implemented
When I perform end-to-end testing on a testnet
Then all acceptance criteria for US-201, US-202, US-203, and US-204 must be met.
And scheduling a delivery must generate a correct calendar invite.
And confirming delivery must trigger the NFT transfer to the correct wallet.

tickets.summary: Foundation: Perform Load and Performance Testing (NFR1)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the application is deployed to a staging environment
When I simulate a load of 10,000 concurrent users during a drop event
Then API endpoints must maintain an average response time of <200ms.
And key pages must achieve a Google PageSpeed score of 90+.
And the system must scale without failure.

tickets.summary: Foundation: Perform Security and Penetration Testing (NFR2)
tickets.gherkin_ac:
Given the application is deployed to a staging environment
When I perform security vulnerability scanning and penetration testing
Then the application must show no critical vulnerabilities from the OWASP Top 10.
And bot mitigation strategies must be effective against basic scripting.
And all data must be confirmed as encrypted at rest and in transit.
